newsitem.title: USA: L-3 Communications to sell $200 mln debt-sources.
newsitem.headline: L-3 Communications to sell $200 mln debt-sources.

text.p: L-3 Communications Corp plans to sell $200 million in high-yield bonds as part of its spinoff from Lockheed Martin in the next several weeks, market sources said.
The offering of senior subordinated notes will be underwritten by Lehman Brothers Inc, they added.
An L-3 spokeswoman declined to comment.
Following the spin-off, the company will be jointly-owned by a Lehman Brothers investment partnership, Lockheed Martin and a management team comprising certain former Lockheed Martin executives.

The total value of the spin-off will be $525 million. The transaction is expected to close in approximately one month and remains subject to certain regulatory approvals, according to a statement by Lockheed Martin.
L-3 will specialize in high-technology communications products and will be created from 10 non-core business units of Lockheed.
